metadata.name: The last letter
metadata.description: A 12 in 4.5 cm letter and a 6 in 4 cm picture were the only mementos left from an old friend that never came for saying goodbye. Ardalan Sarfaraz is one of the greatest Iranian poets and songwriters of the present time. After the revolution of 1979 in iran,despite his heart's desire, he was forced to leave his homeland. Million people have memory of his poems that arising from grief and sorrow in exile, eternal poems that express the suffering of the people of his country. In the last days before leaving the country , he went to visit his old friend, a friend he never met again. The letter states: Dear Nasser, I came but you weren't , believe me , I cant waste even one day , I came to you in a very bad mood. I will come tomorrow. sincerely , Ardalan These memorabilia were given to me by Nasser , my grandfather , before his death.
